title: 112_hr2586
content: The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" is the short title of this Act, which defines a Swap Execution Facility. The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" defines a Swap Execution Facility under the Commodity Exchange Act, specifying that the Commission cannot impose certain requirements on these facilities. The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to specify limitations on the Commission's requirements for Swap Execution Facilities, including restrictions on displaying bids, limiting means of commerce, and requiring interaction between different trading platforms. The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to specify limitations on the Commission's requirements for Swap Execution Facilities, including restrictions on displaying bids and limiting means of commerce for market participants. The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to specify limitations on the Commission's requirements for Swap Execution Facilities, including restrictions on displaying bids and limiting means of commerce for market participants to enter into and execute security-based swap transactions. The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" may be cited as the Act. It defines a Swap Execution Facility. The "Swap Execution Facility Clarification Act" defines a Swap Execution Facility under the Commodity Exchange Act. It specifies that a swap execution facility is not required to have a minimum number of participants or delay bids/offers. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to clarify the term "Swap Execution Facility" and its requirements, including prohibiting delays in bids/offers and limiting means of commerce for swap transactions. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to clarify the term "Swap Execution Facility" by prohibiting delays in bids/offers and limiting means of commerce for swap transactions. The Commission shall not impose requirements on security-based swap execution facilities regarding minimum participants, bid/response requirements, bid/offer display delays, or limitations on interstate commerce means. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to clarify the term "Swap Execution Facility" by prohibiting delays in bids/offers and limiting means of commerce for swap transactions. The Commission shall not impose requirements on security-based swap execution facilities regarding minimum participants, bid/response requirements, bid/offer display delays, or limitations on interstate commerce means. Additionally, transactions on trading systems or platforms operated by the swap execution facility must interact with each other. SEC. 3. IMPLEMENTATION. The amendments made by this Act shall be implemented without regard to chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code, and the notice and comment provisions of section 553 of title 5, United States Code, through the promulgation of an interim final rule.
